newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Philippines seen beating inflation target - Singson.
newsitem.headline: Philippines seen beating inflation target - Singson.

text.p: Philippine central bank governor Gabriel Singson said on Friday in Hong Kong there was a good chance the Philippines could better the government's inflation target.
Singson said he was "quite confident" having seen the latest inflation figures for February advancing at a 4.4 percent clip.
"There is a good chance that we can do better than our (inflation) target," he told Reuters Financial Television.
Earlier this year, Manila set an inflation target of six to seven percent for 1997 against 7.5 to 8.5 percent estimated for 1996.
The Philippines has projected an estimated Gross National Product growth of seven to eight percent in 1997 against 6.5-7.5 last year.
Singson said he expects the economic reforms launched by Fidel Ramos's economic reform to be carried forward by the next president.
